oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Willie Nelson interview part 3 - Biff Collie Inside Nashville
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part three of a recording of an interview with Willie Nelson (performer), conducted by Biff Collie (host) for his radio program Inside Nashville.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie asks about Willie Nelson's athletic interests -- Willie Nelson talks about playing golf (incomplete) -- Nelson talks about the people he goes on tour with -- Nelson talks about how Elvis popularized security traveling with music stars -- Nelson talks about how many of his old friends go on tour with him -- Nelson talks about Chet Atkins and a new guitar he made -- Nelson talks about Jimmy Carter being a friend of his and him being a great man -- Nelson talk about being hesitant to take Charlie Pride to Texas because of his ethnicity, but doing it anyway -- Nelson talks about not wanting to follow Pride because of how much the crowd loved him -- Nelson talks about Leon Russell being the greatest entertainer he knows -- Nelson talks about Paul English being his oldest, closest friend, and being his drummer -- Nelson talks about Kris Kristofferson being the finest writer around in the country music scene -- Nelson talks about Tom Paul Glaser being one of the original Outlaws -- Nelson talks about what it means to be an Outlaw, which is to go against the norm -- Nelson talks about Darryl Roy being the greatest country music fan in the world -- Nelson talks about needed a lot of time to talk about Hank Cochran, he is a friend and a great songwriter -- Nelson talks about some times he got fired from jobs -- Nelson talks about being a disc jockey -- Nelson talks about Ray Price being one of his first bosses and playing bass for him -- Nelson talks about being in favor of religion and that he used to teach Sunday school -- Nelson talks about religious people getting carried away with their own importance -- Nelson talks about believing in reincarnation and heaven and hell being within our own minds -- Nelson says eternity is now, and it is impossible for energy to die -- Nelson says his favorite hymn is Precious Memories -- Nelson talks about telling a story in his songs over the course of his life -- Nelson talks about Charlie Daniels being a great friend and a great musician -- Nelson talks about Johnny Cash in the same way -- Nelson talks about Larry Gatlin being a great songwriter and singer (incomplete)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Nelson, Willie, 1933-;
